intro: Tyleria tremuloidea, commonly known as the trembling tyleria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, trembling leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Tyleria tremuloidea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
